extendedIngredients.name: chive
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 chive flowers, florets removed from the flower head base on the main stem (or 1 tablespoon chopped chives)

extendedIngredients.name: flavoring syrup
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/2 teaspoon your favorite chopped flavoring herb, such as dill, celery seed, basil, oregano (optional)
metaInformation: such as dill, celery seed, basil, oregano

extendedIngredients.name: sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup sugar (I used half sugar and half truvia)
metaInformation: (I used half sugar and half truvia)

extendedIngredients.name: white wine vinegar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/3 cup rice wine vinegar or white wine vinegar

recipes.title: Chive Flower and Cucumber Salad
recipes.instructions: Whisk all of the vinaigrette ingredients together in a small bowl until the sugar is dissolved.  Set aside.Add the vegetables and about half of the chive florets to a medium bowl and toss lightly.  Drizzle the vinaigrette over the salad and give it stir.  Sprinkle the remaining florets over the salad as a garnish. Chill for at least an hour.  Can be made a day ahead.

steps.step: Whisk all of the vinaigrette ingredients together in a small bowl until the sugar is dissolved.  Set aside.
Add the vegetables and about half of the chive florets to a medium bowl and toss lightly.
Drizzle the vinaigrette over the salad and give it stir.  Sprinkle the remaining florets over the salad as a garnish. Chill for at least an hour.  Can be made a day ahead.
